result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: (REDUCED FROM $2500.00) No contact with: S.W. Defendant must remain 1000 feet away from S.W. Defendant to not enter the town of Saukville.
Copy of information provided to counsel who waives reading and enters a not guilty plea. Bail motion heard. State opposes bail motion. Court will reduce bail to $1500.00

1:21 PM Defendant Robert Alexandru Crnkovich appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Robert Alexandru Crnkovich.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Defendant does qualify for PD representation. State requesting $2500 cash bail with conditions. Counsel advises Defendant turned self in. Counsel requesting prelim hearing be set within time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
